implementation.name: read_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to retrieve all tasks. Supports listing tasks for management.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a GET request is made to /tasks:
    Call database.get_tasks()
    Return the list of tasks

implementation.name: get_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Reads all tasks from the persistent storage (tasks.json). Used by endpoints to fetch tasks.
implementation.pseudo_code:
If tasks.json does not exist:
    Return empty list
Open tasks.json
Try to load JSON data
    For each item, create a Task object
    Return list of Task objects
If JSON decode fails:
    Return empty list

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task. Receives all required fields and delegates creation to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to /tasks with TaskCreate data:
    Call database.add_task(task)
    Return the created Task

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Creates a new Task with all required fields and saves it. Ensures all fields from TaskCreate are present.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Create a new Task with a unique id and fields from TaskCreate
Append new Task to tasks list
Save tasks list to tasks.json
Return the new Task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task. Receives updated fields and delegates update to the database layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a PUT request is made to /tasks/{task_id} with TaskCreate data:
    Call database.update_task(task_id, task)
    If updated_task is None:
        Raise 404 error
    Return updated_task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Updates an existing task with new data. Ensures all fields are updated as per TaskCreate.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
For each task in tasks:
    If task.id matches task_id:
        Create updated Task with new data
        Replace old task with updated Task
        Save tasks list
        Return updated Task
If not found, return None

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete a task by id.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a DELETE request is made to /tasks/{task_id}:
    Call database.delete_task(task_id)
    If not success:
        Raise 404 error
    Return success message

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Removes a task from the persistent storage by id.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Filter out the task with matching id
If a task was removed:
    Save updated tasks list
    Return True
Else:
    Return False
